intro: Hippomane zeocca, commonly known as the rubber tree, is a species native to parts of South America. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and a milky latex sap that is tapped for industrial use. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. Its roots are fibrous, and it can grow up to several meters in height. The latex produced by Hippomane zeocca has been historically used in the production of rubber and other industrial products.
